summary: This bill, the Agricultural Access to Substance Use Disorder Treatment and Mental Health Care Act of 2025, mandates a study by the Comptroller General of the United States. The study will assess the availability and accessibility of substance use disorder treatment and mental health services for farmers and ranchers, focusing on barriers, best practices, and the utilization of the Farm and Ranch Stress Assistance Network. The report, due within two years of enactment, will be submitted to various congressional committees and relevant federal agencies, offering recommendations for improvement.
